text: Carex petitiana is a species of sedge in the family Cyperaceae that lives in swamps and bogs at altitudes of in Cameroon, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Ethiopia, Kenya, Malawi, Nigeria, Tanzania, Uganda and Zimbabwe. Two subspecies are recognised: *C. petitiana subsp. attenuata – only recorded from Malawi and Zimbabwe *C. petitiana subsp. petitiana (Kük.) Luceño & M. Escudero – throughout the species' range ==References== petitiana Category:Flora of Africa Category:Plants described in 1850 Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Carex petitiana
